title: Ticket #6795: "FROM INSTANCE" credentials should be cached
description:
We don't currently cache the security credentials obtained from the instance meta-data server. This is particularly egregious because we're already fetching the expiration for these temporary credentials but not actually using it for anything. (AWS recommends renewing the credentials >15 minutes before the expire.)

For simplicity (and probably, correctness), the cache should be in memory and per-GAHP; if a GAHP terminates from idleness before the cache expires, we're clearly not issuing so many commands that fetching the credentials again will be a problem.
